Darwin preferred observing nature more than studying and he spent most of his time out collecting rocks, observing insects or hunting down birds.

Charles,

what’s that book you’re reading?

I thought you were

only interested in

insects and plants,

but now birds too!

It’s called The Natural

History of Selborne and it describes nature observations conducted in Selborne. It’s

got great records of the

habits of birds.

You’re the first

person I’ve ever

met to have such

a unique hobby.

Well, yeah, um… Hee-hee.

When I went to

Wales I noticed so many

insects and bugs. It

would have been nice

if we had gone

together.

Wales?

20
